title: How to become a good teacher when I've not taught in a class before - Quora

response.answer_text: im assuming you meant not taught in a class before.i dont know,if i had to do that as a seat of the pants exploration,id slowly cover the material.if necessary make diagrams on the black board to help demonstrate ideas http://etc.id look at the faces of students to see if they can follow my train of thought,find it interesting what im saying,after a while id open it up to discussion,questions try to make them think about material in various ways,maybe get creative within bounds.kind of feel my way along,what works,what doesnt.depends on material involved.you have to know what you are talking about.

You need some training; you need to see a variety of successful teachers at their craft. Early in my training I read John Holt’s book How Children Fail. I think for me it was enlightening and perhaps because it made me think or try to think from a child’s view. In fact, my second hubby, when asked what his wife taught answers ‘children’ rather than Maths or Computing and in many ways I think that is the key. Yes, you are imparting knowledge but you are doing so much more than that. You are an example, you hope to light an enthusiasm for learning that will carry your pupils throughout their lives.

In your class, do the following: Expect that not all students consider what you are teaching to be important to their success in life. Reach out to them is a special way.Even though you may have to use terms unfamiliar to them, explain everything in simple terms.Ask for their comments and input on topics being taught.Make it clear what they are accountable for on a test.
